title: Cool!
content: 안에 들어가서셔 교실과 건물안 작은 카페에서 커피도 드시고 구경하세요. 여기 바깥에서 사진 찍으면 참 예쁘고요, 사실 안에 들어가서 구경하는걸 더 추천해 드리고 싶네요!! 캠브릿지 오면, 사람들 제가 구경시켜 드리는 곳중 하나입니다. ( 캠브릿지 거주인)

title: 열려있는 융합학문의 요람
content: Boston가면 꼭 가보세요.1. 실험실이 오픈형으로 구성되어 건물 안 복도 걸으며 연구하고 실험하는 학생들을 직접 볼 수 있음2. 도서관쪽 넓은 뜰은 일광욕에 좋고 강을 바라보며 힐링하기 좋음3. 젊고 활기 찬 남자 학생들이 자전거타고 많이 다녀서 활력을 느낄 수 있음4. MIT뮤지엄은 유료프로그램으로 운영되고 학생을 둔 부모에게는 좋은 교육도 될 수 있음5. 하버드가 옆에 있어 일정 잡아 같이 돌아 볼 수 있음

title: 가을에 8학년이 되는 아들과 함께한 MIT tour
content: 하버드 대학은 대학의 외관만 둘러볼 수 있는 것과 달리 MIT는 건물 내부까지 구석구석 둘러 볼 수 있었다. 버스를 타고 냐렸을 때 그 황량함에 충격을 받았다가 본관으로 캠퍼스의 분위기를 곧바로 느낄 수 있었다.

title: 보스턴의 유명대학교
content: MIT는 세계 최고의 공과대학답게 캠퍼스 곳곳에서 인재양성의 중요성과 자존감을 가르치면서 스스로 깨닫게 한다는 느낌을 갖게했다. 투어 마지막에 던져준 여학생의 메시지는 강렬하다 "대학생활은 공부하느라 힘들다 하지만 도전하라 얻는 유익이 더 클것이다"

title: 강변을 따라 산책하며 보이는 건물 창 사이로 보이는 학생들의 모습이 인상적
content: MIT또한 하버드에 버금가는 유명 대학교잖아요. 관광객도 많고 멋진 건물들이 많았던 캠퍼스였어요. 하버드랑 그렇게 멀리 떨어져있지 않고 지하철로 연결이 되어있어서 편리하게 여행할 수 있었어요.

title: MIT 공과 대학
content: 하버드 갈때와 마찬가지로 여기도 왠지 천재들만 모여있을 것 같은 생각에 어마어마한 규모의 캠퍼스를 거닐다 만난 농구하는 청년들까지도 왠지 대단해보였던 곳. 바로 옆에 강이 흐르는데 그 강을 뷰삼아 공부할 수 있는 건물들이 많고 건물 창이 통유리로 넓게되어있어 공부하는 학생들의 모습이 보였다. 나도 공부하고 싶은 가슴속 설레는 꿈을 꺼내보게 만드는 그야말로 캠퍼스스러운 풍경들.

title: MIT대학
content: 세계 최고의 공과 대학이라는 MIT의 건물들은 하버드 대학처럼 고풍스럽지 않고 현대적인것이 공대 느낌이 물씬 나는 곳입니다. 우리 아이가 진학하길 기대해봅니다.

title: 최고의 공과대학
content: 요즘 아이비리그 대학투어를 많이들 하신다고 하네요...저는 대학투어는 아니고 친구들과 한번 가봤어요...방학이라서그런지 학생들은 많지안더라구요..안에들어가니 정숙한분위기와 학교시설등.......분위기가 조성되있다는 생각이 들었습니다.건물도 깔끔하고 MIT학생들이라그런지 공부잘할거같이생긴거같기도하고요..ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ

title: MIT media lab을 꼭 가보세요
content: 최고의 수재들이 몰려있는 MIT. 특색있는 건축물로 흥미를 이끄는 곳이다. 아이와 함께 한번쯤 방문하길 권한다

title: 건물이 굉장히 인상적입니다
content: 뉴스에서 건너 듣기만 하던 수많은 새로운 발명품들이 이 학교에서 쏟아져나온다고 생각하면 신기하기만 합니다. 제목에서 말씀드린 미디어랩을 들어가보시면 정말 대단하다는 생각밖에 안납니다. 새로 개발중인 제품들, 이미 개발을 마친 제품들이 전시되어있습니다.

title: 시간과 돈의 낭비
content: 일요일이라 한적했는데, 기기묘묘하게 생긴 건물들이 무척 인상적입니다. 다만 특이한 건물 말고는 그다지 인상적인 것은 없습니다. 교내로 들어가는 버스도 거의 없어서 많이 걸어야 합니다.

title: MIT의 실망스러운 캠퍼스 투어
content: 가이드는 실마리가 없었고 여행에 관심이 없는 것 같았습니다. 그는 가장 쉬운 질문에도 대답하지 못했습니다. 시간과 돈이 얼마나 낭비입니까!

title: NSA, CIA 및 기타 여러 가지 사악한 기관의 번식지 인 사악한 기관.
content: 건물과 캠퍼스가 못 생겼습니다. 아마도 2 월이었고 자연이없는 것처럼 보이지만 캠퍼스는 브라질 영화와 같은 매우 산업적인 느낌을 가지고 있습니다. 우리는 서쪽과 동쪽 사이의 복도를 걸었고, 교실을 보았고 캠퍼스를 걸었습니다. 건물 내부와 외부가 더러워 보였다. 우리는 운동장을 방문했습니다. 수영장 지역은 좋았지 만 아이스 하키 장은 평균 이하였습니다. 우리는 토요일에 방문했고 캠퍼스는 학생들로 바쁘지 않았습니다 (아마도 연구). 캠퍼스 이외의 도시에서는 그다지 할 일이 많지 않습니다. MIT 캠퍼스를 방문하거나 하버드를 선택할 수 있다면 하버드를 선택합니다.

title: 캠브리지의 구시가지 갈트
content: 저는 행복 합니다. 있는 것도 없어요. 저는 아무것도 볼 수 foward. 제가 의사와 치과 의사 appts 가끔 appts. 나는 내 가족이 살고 있는 수도 있습니다. 살고 있지 않을 것입니다. 저는 매우 불쾌 하고 매우 느낌 입니다. 나는 지금 모든 것이 가깝고 키치너. 나는 차가 필요하지 않습니다. 저는 걸어서 여기저기. 케임브리지 이 어디까지 모든 것이 걸을 수 없습니다. 추가할 수 있는 방법 등이 온타리오.

title: 멋진 곳을 방문하는 라이브.
content: 여행을 하기에도, 지내기에도 아름 다운 작은 도시예요. 그랜드 리버가 주는 풍경이 참 소박하고 아름다워요.

title: 멋진 리버 워크
content: 저는 2 년 전에 여기. 정말 멋진 곳이 많고 친절한 분위기 에서 제공하는 로컬 술집 극장! 가족이 더욱 훌륭한 장소입니다.

title: 출생 장소
content: 많은 사람들의 결혼식이 있는데 여기에 좋은 사진. 양쪽 모두 걸어갈 수 있는 강. 피크닉을 즐길 수 있는, 생선은 휴식.

title: 좋은 아키텍처!
content: 아름다운 도시의 모든 아름다운 건물 & 교회 브리지,,, 너무 아름다워서 다음 방법을 잘 모를 수 있는 맞춤법 검사 및 꽃 나무 매그놀리아 칼타피아

title: 케임브리지의 한 부분이다.
content: 아름다워요! 여유롭게 산책 하고 시가지, 강을 따라 가. 커피도 하루 묵기, 점심을 즐길 수 있는 계속. 3 강이 시내에 있는 다리에 교차 갈트. 높은 첨탑과 아름다운 오래된 전통 있는 교회, 시청 한 수상 에게 " 녹색 ". 제공된 새 블렌드 에 통합할 수 있습니다. 사랑스러운 작은 시장에서 할 수 있는 토요일 아침. 신선한 초콜릿 을 구입하고 레이즈 에서, 이 지역에서 유명한 chocolatier. 할 수 있는 동종 요법 의 저장과 같은 거리 에서 더 많은 것을. 마음에 쏙 드는 작은 다운타운 지역! 그리고 제가 언급한, 위대한 음악 페스티벌이 개최 거리 이 확인할 것이다. 항상 생각합니다.

title: 그랜드 리버뷰 좋은 곳
content: 라이브 도 아름다워요. 회색의 작은 식당들이 있다. 음식을 먹을 수 있는 강. 한 일 년 중.

title: 아름다운 도시를 방문하는
content: 한 아름다운 도시 입니다. 볼 수 있는 그랜드 강 커피숍, 또는 카페 방문 지역, 지역 교회 역사에 보기 좋았습니다. 실제로 이 갈트, 케임브리지의 일원. 오래된 석조 교회는 많은 여러 지역의 역사, 그 중에서 가장 오래된 갈트. 아일랜드어 느낌이고. 이 모노그램 커피 샵 좋은 곳입니다. 강변을 따라 산책로가 있는. 제가 본 많은 사람들이 하루를 보내지 도 아이들이 모여 있었어요. 저는 많은 도시를 구경하는 것을 추천 나 하고 사진. 이 또한 좋은 겨울에 좋은 여름. 강력 추천합니다.

title: 내 삶의 이동 시간!!!
content: 멋진 곳 입니다. 멋진 오래된 석조 교회 를 볼 수 있는 아름다운 강. 커피를 마신 커피 모노그램 을 강력히 추천 합니다. 또한 토요일은 농부의 시장 하기. 고기 생산이 많은 선택!

title: 아키텍처
content: 저는 이 아름다운 도시 로 옮깁니다 갈트, 케임브리지의 도시. 제 새 집의 아름다운 강을 내려다 볼 수 있는 그랜드. 나는 오래된 역사적인 지역을 방문 하고 내가 앞으로 시내에 갈트. 실행 강 서쪽 은 함께 교회 간 spired 의 화려한, 아름다운 오래된 주택 의 쾌적한 아키텍처 및 주요 거리 동쪽에 있는 작은 오두막 을 사용. 여기에서 볼 수 있는 작은 상점, 대형 은행 들, 농민 과 아주 유명한 ' 시장에서 조금 떨어져 있는. 정말 기분이 유럽의 도시 같은 당신의 방문. 그림 같은 곳이기 때문이다. 하루에 점심이나 저녁 늦게 완료 케임브리지 밀. 볼, 아름다운 다리, 어부, 코코 와 폭포. 음식과 서비스도 훌륭하다. 나는 즐겁게 볼 수 있습니다 전체를 보장. 아마 오늘도 들 수 있습니다. 이 말은 뒤에 남겨두고 갈트 마을. 물론 이 계속 여기 에 친구 들 을 때. 방문이 과거, 현재 및 미래의! ! !

title: 갤트. 우리 동네?
content: 드라이브를 로컬 라이브러리 또는 커뮤니티 극장 은 아래에 있는 곳입니다. Emc 는 모든 오래된 아키텍처, 혼합된 새 건물. 우리는 공원과 강 을 따라 산책. 하고 있었기 때문에 주변 레스토랑에서 라이브 공연을 하기 전에 플레이어 캠브리지 커뮤니티 극장. 우리 모두는 자원 봉사자 이 기 때문에 정기적으로 방문 한 라이브러리 분기 합니다. 항상 무언가를 하고 있습니다. 아트 표시되며, 활동 등.

title: 살아 있는 시간을
content: 솔직히. 여기에 많은 것이 지. 시내에 있는 한, 많지 않은 것을. 아니 감사합니다. 시간을.

title: 하버드 광장
content: 노숙자들이, 나는 지역이 매우 깨끗하고 찾지 못했습니다. 대부분의 포인트 그냥 내가 웃음을 비쌌던 것. 방문할 가치가 없어요.

title: 영국스럽네요
content: 지하철을 타고 하버드 대학교에 방문한다면 이 곳이 하버드 대학교에 도착해서 가장 먼저 보게 될 곳입니다.스타벅스와 여러 레스토랑들이 있습니다.

title: 주말에 축제가 자주 있는것 같음
content: 광장이 고풍스러운 건물로 둘러싸여 있습니다. 건물 하나하나 보는 재미가 있습니다. 하버드는 대학 구경도 좋지만 학교 앞 동네 구경도 참 좋았습니다.

title: 하버드 광장
content: 방문한 날이 주말이었는데 광장에서 전세계 음식점 축제중이었음. 하버드 대학내보다 광장이 더욱 활기찬 느낌을 느낄 수 있으며 아시아 식당이 제법 있으니 필수 방문코스임.

title: 대학가라기보나는 관광지 같습니다
content: 하버드 대학교로 들어가는 입구 같은 곳.하버드 역에서 내리면, 이 곳으로 올라게 오게 된다.우리가 흔히 아는 대학가와 같은 곳으로, 하버드 학생들의 생활을 보고 즐길 수 있다.

title: 하버드 지하철역에 내려서 나오면 볼 수 있는 곳.
content: 독특한 지하철역을 걸어나오면 바로 광장이 펼쳐집니다 길 건너가 하버드대학입낟 광장 중심에는 인포메이션센터가 있어서 하버드대학교 투어 일정을 안내해줍니다 주변에 카페 같은 것도 꽤 들어서 있고 광장을 중심으로 여러갈래의 큰 길이 이어지는데 모두 아기자기한 느낌을 줍니다

title: 하버드대학방문시 자연스럽게 방문하게 되는 곳
content: 하버드 역에서 연결되어 역을 나오면 하버드스퀘어가 나와요.걸어서 얼마안있으면 대학교 입구에 도착할 수 있었구 스퀘어에 스타벅스가 있었어요.

title: 하버드광장
content: 앞에서 공연을 하기도 하고 광장을 둘러싸고 각종 먹을것들이 즐비함. 이곳에서 우노를 처음 방문해 시카고 피자를 즐김. 활기찬 분위기로 샵 몇개 구경해도 시간이 금방 갈 것이다.

title: 방문하기 적당한 장소
content: 이름은 광장이지만 그렇게 크지는 않다. 지하철역에서 나오면 바로이며, 여느 한국의 학교앞과는 달리 유흥시설이 많지는 않다.harvard coop(서점), 기념품 판매점, starbucks등이 있어 어느 관광지에 온 느낌이다.

title: 특히 좋은 날에는 재미있는 장소
content: 볼 것도 많고 먹거리도 많은 혼잡한 동네이다. 대학가와 오래된 역사와 다운타운 느낌이 조금씩 공존하는 느낌. 주위에 작은 먹거리과 샵들을 들러보는 것을 추천한다.

title: 더 이상 뉴스 가판대 없음
content: 하버드의 심장이자 어떤 면에서는 케임브리지의 심장이기도 합니다. 재미있고, 바쁘고, 다양합니다. 방문한다면 꼭 해야 할 일. 볼거리와 할거리가 많습니다.

title: 끔찍한!
content: 하버드 광장에서 신문 가판대가 모두 사라졌습니다! 종이를 살 곳이 없습니다. 얼마나 슬픈. Cardullo's는 아직 거기에 있고 Brattle Theatre와 Charlie's Kitchen도 있습니다. 오래된 랜드마크는 모두 사라졌습니다. Wursthaus, Out of Town News, Jonathan Swift's.

title: 공사 진행 중
content: 부풀려진 가격에 Bluestone Lane 차가운 음식. 찬 수란에 찬 스크램블 에그보다 더 맛없는 것이 몇 가지 있습니다. 우리가 최소한 따뜻할 것으로 예상했던 것이 냉장고에서 바로 나온 것처럼 보였습니다.

title: 주차 금지
content: 광장에서 진행 중인 일부 공사로 인해 지금은 매우 추악합니다. 사진을 잘 찍는 법은 없습니다. 또한 주변의 자동차로 바쁘다.

title: Bugmen의 전체
content: 이 지역에는 멋진 상점이 있으며 a) 햇볕이 잘 드는 따뜻한 날이었고 주차장이 있다면 걸어 다니기에 즐거운 곳입니다. 우리는 거의 1 시간 동안 운전을했고, 당신이 보장 된 주차장에 들어 가지 않고 시간당 $ 12가 아닌 한, 2 시간 최대 만 (우리가 가진 모든 동전)에 신용 카드 주차가없는 40 분 주차를 관리했습니다! ! ! 강요!이 지역은 운전하기에 악몽이기 때문에 많은 도로 공사와 교통량이 있습니다.우리는 심지어 버스를 얻으려고 노력했다. 그러나 (당신이 그것을 추측했던) 교통 때문에 5 마일을가는 데 45 분 걸렸다!

title: 방문 할 때마다 점점 더 칙칙해질 것입니다.
content: 이 지역에는 힙 스터와 벌레들이 있습니다. 우리 대학이 설립 한 교리 센터는 실제 생활 기술은 없지만 교차로에 800 페이지를 쓸 수있는 여러 가지 무장 한 핵을 만들어 내고 있습니다. 여기의 거의 모든 사람들은 공산주의자입니다. 그러나 나는 몇몇 식당이 좋다는 것을 인정할 것이다. 하버드는 테러를 견뎌냅니다.

title: 괜찮지 만 정사각형이 아님.
content: 불행히도, 그 곳은 오래 전에 방랑하는 사람들을위한 수다쟁이가되었습니다. 노동 조합 지부는 그것에 눈 멀고 지방 당국은 그것에 대해 아무 것도하지 않는 것처럼 보인다. 나는 할 수 있으면 그것을 피한다.

title: 그것을 사용하는 것이 아닙니다.
content: 이것은 약간의 잘못된 이름입니다. 우리는 진짜 광장을 기대하고 있었으며, 실제로는 하나도 없었습니다. 따라서 중요한 건축 적 기쁨을 기대하지 마십시오.

title: 더러운
content: 시간이 지남에 따라 사각 지대는 모든 유형의 소규모 중고 상점을 수용하는 지역에서 내려 왔지만, 고가의 임대료 때문에 현재 CVS 및 Chipotle과 같은 음식점과 같은 대형 체인점이 있습니다. 이것은 도시 밖의 학생들에게 편리 할 수 있지만 확실히 광장의 성격을 바 꾸었습니다. Alden, Harlow, Toscano, Harvest와 같은 멋진 레스토랑이 있지만 카사 블랑카 또는 알제를 떠나는 장소를 잃어 버리지는 않습니다.

title: 별로임
content: 매우 불쾌한. 하버드 대학교가 얼마나 더러운 지에 대해 나쁜 견해를 갖게되었습니다. 휴지통, 하수구 냄새, 많은 건축물 때문에 먼지가 많았습니다.

title: 가볼만한 곳
content: 이 지루한 박물관입니다. 제가 기대했던 것 이상이 하버드 가 있기를 내야 하는데. 비교할 수 없는 전혀 다른 자연사 박물관이 나기 전에.

title: Glass flowers
content: 학교 앞에 있어 신경을 안쓰고 있다가 우연히 들르게 되었는데 정말 볼게 많고 잘 꾸며놓은 곳이었어요. 크기는 작지만 있을 것은 다 있고, 특히 거대한 자라, 실러캔스, 고래인지 공룡인지 알 수 없는 생물체의 화석 등이 볼만했어요. 아이와 함께 가면 좋은 곳이에요.

title: 하버드 자연사 박물관
content: 하버드에 리서치 방문을 했다가 이곳 교수로 있는 예전 동료의 추천을 받고 방문.전체적인 전시는 다른 자연사 박물관과 크게 다르지 않지만 Glass Flowers는 꼭 시간을 갖고 살펴보기를 추천. 뜻밖에 관심을 갖게 한 곳은 살아있는 벌을 유인해 벌집의 내부를 직접 벌 수 있게 만든 곳. 하버드 주변에 가족 혹은 개인여행을 한다면 최소 1시간 이상의 여유를 갖고 들려볼만 한 곳.

title: 생각보다 전시가 훌륭한 곳
content: 하버드 대학교 내에 전시된 자연사 박물관.하버드 라는 이름값이 있어서 유명한 거긴 하지만, 기타 큰 자연사 박물관에 비하면, 아쉬운 감이 없잖아 있다.반대로 생각하면, 교육시설에서 이만한 전시시설을 갖추었다는 점에서 높은 점수를 줄 만하다.

title: 엄청난 공룡뼈와 다채로운 전시를 볼 수 있는 곳
content: 현지인들도 잘 모르는 하버드 대학의 자연사 박물관은 의외로 전시품이 많습니다. 입구의 운석이나 돌 전시는 어느 박물관보다 많이 전시되어 있고, 공룡 뼈도 꽤 있습니다. 빠른 속도로 둘러보아도 두 시간 이상은 걸릴 정도, 아이들이 정말 좋아합니다.

title: 하버드 박물관은 보석이다
content: 제일 기억에 남는건 다른분들도 사진 남긴 엄청난 크기의 공룡뼈. 공룡이 이만했었겠구나..하고 실질적으로 와닿는 정도의 크기. 그 외에도 볼거리가 많고 탄생석 전시도 볼만했었다. 깔끔하고 관리가 잘되는 곳.

title: 그래도 좋아요
content: GoCity Pass를 이용하여 캠퍼스를 산책하고 박물관을 둘러보았습니다. 볼 것이 많고, 보낼 수 있는 시간은 무제한입니다. 모든 층에 매우 인상적인 디스플레이가 있습니다. 우리는 특히 두 명의 지질학적 엔지니어가 파티에 참석한 보석/바위 전시를 즐겼습니다.

title: 자연사 버프에 딱 맞습니다.
content: 유리꽃과 광물/바위가 매혹적입니다. 현재 유리꽃 전시관에는 이러한 '표본'의 제작에 대한 정보와 깨진 표본을 수리하는 내용이 전시되어 있다. 지질학 전시회에서 얻은 거대 암몰라이트 표본이 정말 멋지네요! 과소평가됐어요!

title: 기적의 유리 경이로움과 숨겨진 보석
content: 공룡에서 유리 꽃에 이르기까지 다양한 자연사 전시 컬렉션이 있습니다. 상대적으로 저렴하지만 주차 공간을 찾을 수 있다면 정말 끔찍합니다. 모든 전시물은 장애인 입장이 불가능합니다.

title: 재미있고 유익한 정보
content: 유리 식물 컬렉션에 정말 감동하고 특히 흥분했습니다. 이것은 진정한 기적이며 예술 박물관의 옆집에도 봉사할 수 있습니다. 내 두려움은 대부분의 사람들이 특히 확대를 보고 있는 것이 어떤 경이인지 단서가 없다는 것입니다. 박물관의 나머지 부분도 독특한 공룡과 아메리카 원주민과 같은 다른 전시물을 방문할 가치가 있습니다.

title: 솔직히 후회했어요.
content: 나는 몇 년 동안 이 박물관에 가본 적이 없으며 이곳에 다시 올 기회를 갖게 되어 정말 기뻤습니다. 이 박물관은 공룡에서 희귀한 암석과 광물에 이르기까지 거의 모든 것으로 가득 차 있으며 모든 것이 너무 매력적이어서 모든 것을 제대로 보려면 몇 시간이 걸릴 수 있습니다. 유리 바다 생물 전시회는 환상적이었고 유리 꽃 (부팅하기에 화려함)도 마찬가지였습니다. Thoreau의 꽃 전시도 좋았습니다. 모든 전시회는 매우 철저하고 명확하게 선별되었습니다. 여전히 국제적인 기여를 배제하지 않는 미국 역사에 대한 비 징고 주의적 초점이 있습니다.

title: 스터피 올드 박물관
content: 규모면에서 워싱턴과 뉴욕에 비교할 바는 아니지만 정말 부실한 곳이에요. 솔직히 후회했구요, 한 20분 만에 나왔어요. 세계 최고대학교 안에 있는 곳이었지만 학술을 위한 가치를 얼마나 뛰어날지 모르겠지만 관광객이 가기엔 그다지 훌륭하지 않다고 생각해요.

title: 가난한 전시
content: 악취가 나는 답답한 공기로 인해 방문이 매우 불편해졌습니다. 여기에는 보존된 동물과 박제된 동물이 많이 포함됩니다. 반드시 마스크를 착용하세요. 1900년에 디자인된 박물관이 생각나네요. 하버드는 입학금을 청구하는 것을 부끄러워해야합니다.

title: 주차가 어디
content: 이는 가난한 박물관, 회계 오늘날 기대 이상이었습니다. 젊은 사람들이 상호 작용 활동을 하고 있습니다 하고 지루해 그냥 보고 정보를 읽고. 기대 이상의 장소에서 학습 시설이 있고, 특히 즐거운 내야 하는데 $12, 않습니다!

title: 에 기대
content: 말하지 않을 수 있기 때문에 주차할 수 있는 박물관이 발견되지 않았다. 한 시간 정도 운전 하기, 그리고 주변을 찾아 스펏. 케임브리지에 주차할 수 있는 모든 작업을 수행할 수 있습니다. 계량 주차 입구 건너편에 있는 공간은 별로 없다. 주차 차고 에 없습니다. 매우 가난한 계획. 격노 시키는 말하고 싶은 것. 다른 곳으로 가는 친절한 추가 드라이버!

title: beautiful park
content: We haven't returned there for a couple of years but as soon as we entered the cottage we noticed that the hot tub was empty.  They did immediately fixed the issue and gave us free breakfast. This last stay when we entered the cottage the hot tub was cold and would not warm up. Maintenance said it was a half hour fix but would take 3-4 hours to use it. Maintenence was there for 2 hours and was still there when we were told that management would take $100 off our stay. I would rather be told that we would need to go to another cottage or even return the money. We left after staying just over an hour and a half. We didn't even get the $100.00 deducted that they said they would do either. The park was beautiful, but I would never stay at the cottage again.

title: Beautiful place, affordable and excellent food and service.
content: Lots to see! Very much overlooked. We hung out at the beach, rented kayaks, hiked and hung out by the fire. Lots of things to check out nearby.

title: Gorgeous lake.
content: Food at the lodge is very good. Reduced menu size but it’s all prepared and planned to satisfy patrons. Worth the time to enjoy the setting and food. Prices are very reasonable breakfast and dinner WITH a lunch in a wildlife bar.

title: Adoramos!
content: We visited Salt Fork state park in June  22 for a day trip and did some hiking.   We were impressed with how pretty it was - a bit surprised at the lack of trail maintenance.  By the end we were actually doing a bit of clearing some of the trails ourselves.  Theres a lot of flies and a fair bit of poison ivy.  Long pants were a good idea.   We visited Stone House museum which is a nice old house with a great view.  The latrine there was surprisingly in that the women's side had some kind of wasps overhead and a very  very large spider in there.  I used the mens instead.  There is a nice dock by the museum and we sat on that and had a snack - dangled our feet in the water.  It was quiet and pretty.We had some dinner in the lodge bar.    Like everywhere these days I think they are probably struggling for help.   There was just the one bartender/waitress there and she was swamped - but she still gave us good service and we thought our food tased pretty good.  We visited again for an overnight stay in the primitive camp ground in July 22.   We brought our kayaks and paddled both days.   The paddling was pretty great.  The lake is huge and we explored two different parts of it.   Because we had paid for camping we were able to use the main campground beach and kayak put in and the shower buildings over there.  That was all quite nice.   We enjoyed our post-paddle swims here.  The primitive campground where we stayed was quiet and maybe 40% full?  Nice picnic table and fire ring.  We were not close to the other tents.   There are 4 clusters of tent camping spots and two of them have latrines in them.  Only one had potable water.  The latrines are pretty old style - like no lids on the pits which means the smell is worse and so are the flies.     They could be nicer for sure.     I'm glad I reserved a camping spot in one of the clusters farther from the latrine.Very little traffic down the primitive camp road.   Woke to a lot of birds singing.   Saw a few scarlet tanagers flitting around as we ate our breakfast next to the tent.    Saw a few hummingbirds as well.On the water we saw turtles and many heron,  and lots of fish jumping.   All in all I think Salt Fork could use some updating but its a really gorgeous place hidden in rural Ohio.

title: Highly Recommend for New Years Eve
content: Adoramos o parque! É lindo! SaiMos da Florida de RV e fomos até o parque. Ficamos por uma semana.Tudo funcionou bem: espaço da RV, banheiros, lavanderia.Pontos à melhorar: a loja que vende gelo funciona das 09 ( ou 10 ) até as 06pm. Se vc precisar de gelo ( ou qq outra coisa) você terá que procurar um mercado. Sugestão: oferecer alguns cursos, tipo de pesca ou canoagem. Dica: peque seu spot de RV próximo a praianha.No mais, voltaremos com certeza!

title: Cabin reveiw
content: Spending New Years Eve here and we are having a blast! We are a full family with kids (adults, teens and younger) and they have set up numerous things for kids to do; scavenger hunt, movies, archery, prizes, face paint, ice cream social … and much more. They had a schedule of activities thru the day.  There was a kid friendly countdown and also a separate adults only countdown to midnight.  The lodge also has many things in the lounge that are adult only for those that are trying to enjoy an adult night. Rooms and lodge are cozy and clean. Staff has been helpful and very friendly. We feel very welcome. We’ve been looking for a new kid oriented place to spend New Years Eve and we found it! We will definitely be back.  I would recommend Salt Fork to anyone!

title: Excellent Hiking Opportunities
content: Very nicely appointed cabins with big screen TVs and hot tubs included in each cabin, sleeps six with immediate access to the lake right out the back.

title: Very nice park with great facilities.
content: I visited Salt Fork State Park in Lore City with a friend on a day trip from Columbus on a fine summer day.  The main purpose of our outing was to go on a couple of hikes.  First we stopped at the Visitor Center (not open) and picked up a trail map.  We enjoyed the short (1/2 mile) Mosak's Cave Trail where the trail ended at a cave with a waterfall.  Getting to the top of the cave is prohibited due to the danger of falls from cliffs.  Our second hike was the Stone House Loop Trail (about 2 miles).  For the front leg of this hike we took the lake side trail, and had good views of the lake; and on the return leg we took the landside trail which had more rock formations.  Both sections were quite woodsy.  The Stone House was closed, but we still enjoyed walking around the historic building.  The trail is well maintained.  Note that the Stone House also has roadway access.Salt Fork State Park is a nice park with lots of recreational opportunities, though we explored only a part of the hiking trails during our half day visit.

title: A place of natural beauty
content: Be sure to check out everything the park has on-line, as there's plenty to do. Love to come the next chance we get.

title: I highly recommend!
content: It is easy to see why Salt Fork was made into a State Park.  We were particularly impressed with the swimming beaches.  We didn't stay in a cabin but it was tempting to see them tucked away into the trees and close to the lake.

title: beautiful park
content: My wife, two daughters, and I recently returned from our second stay in a chalet cabin. Everything was great! The cabin was nice and clean, the girls loved the bunk beds, and we all thought the hot tub was fantastic. The employees at Salt Fork State Park went above and beyond - both during our stay and working with us in advance to book our trip. In fact, their amazing customer service was a big part of the reason we returned - and we will definitely be back for yet another visit.

title: Beautiful place, affordable and excellent food and service.
content: Lots to see! Very much overlooked. We hung out at the beach, rented kayaks, hiked and hung out by the fire. Lots of things to check out nearby.

content: Food at the lodge is very good. Reduced menu size but it’s all prepared and planned to satisfy patrons. Worth the time to enjoy the setting and food. Prices are very reasonable breakfast and dinner WITH a lunch in a wildlife bar.

content: Be sure to check out everything the park has on-line, as there's plenty to do. Love to come the next chance we get.

content: It is easy to see why Salt Fork was made into a State Park.  We were particularly impressed with the swimming beaches.  We didn't stay in a cabin but it was tempting to see them tucked away into the trees and close to the lake.

title: Great pandemic getaway
content: My wife, two daughters, and I recently returned from our second stay in a chalet cabin. Everything was great! The cabin was nice and clean, the girls loved the bunk beds, and we all thought the hot tub was fantastic. The employees at Salt Fork State Park went above and beyond - both during our stay and working with us in advance to book our trip. In fact, their amazing customer service was a big part of the reason we returned - and we will definitely be back for yet another visit.

title: Large State Park With A Variety of Attractions
content: My husband and I were there in October 2020 and we had a great weekend. We stayed in a king room in the lodge and were pleasantly surprised by how roomy it was. It also came with a fridge and a microwave, so we brought our own breakfast food so we didn't have to deal with masks/restaurants going out for breakfast. We also were surprised by the bar at the lodge; we didn't expect to feel safe enough to eat there, but the tables were spaced far apart, the waitresses wore masks, and the high cathedral ceiling helped it not feel closed in. Plus the waitresses and the food were really great. We ate there Fri and Sat night. There were nice hiking trails at the park too and a nice disc golf course nearby, and we picked up lunch to go at a restaurant in nearby Byesville, Marlene's Rsetaurant & Bar -- people weren't masking  there but got food to go for lunch and I got some of the best pancakes I've ever had, world class. All in all, a great weekend.

title: Beautiful color of the trees in the fall
content: We've visited Salt Fork State Park at least twice, most recently in the late fall in November 2020.Salt Fork is in a very rural part of Ohio, but it is easy to access as it is only about 5-10 minutes from I-77. The park itself is enormous, something like 20,000 acres (or about 30 square miles) and it feels like it. The heart of the park is a 3,000 acre lake that meanders everywhere, so there are ample good views of it.They have a little bit of everything here. There is a lodge with pool and (during non-pandemic times) a restaurant. There is camping. And a golf course. And horse trails. And a nature center. And fishing. You get the idea . . . We came here on a fine fall afternoon and mostly enjoyed the views. There are trails all over for both hikers and horseback riders.Towards the north end of the park (which is more or less the farthest point from the entrance) there is a ravine that leads to a vary large (maybe 75 foot tall) cave. The trail is short but pretty rough. It makes a nice view, but as tempting as it may look, don't try to climb above the cave as someone died doing so just a few years ago.We did have one quibble with the park, which was the lack of a good map and signage. We were able to find what we wanted, but given the abundance of options we would have liked a better idea of what hikes there were, their length, what you could see, etc.I stayed at the lodge on a business retreat many years ago. It is pretty much as it was in the 1990s and appears to be undergoing some upgrades.This is a nice park with lots of options for a weekend trip, although I suspect that many stay longer.

title: Awesome hikes in a beautiful Park
content: We enjoyed checking out the marinas , pinic areas, beautiful golf course,  many cabins approximately 50, several locations for launching person watercraft, equine area. Also the large beach (closed for the season ) and next to the public beach in a different inlet is a nice dog park all fenced in the edges on land but open on side where the water is located. The park also offers a nice camping area. There are also locations with play grounds for the younger children.Several miles of paved roadways  the Lodge is 7 miles from the entrance to the park. We seen several types of wildlife,  deer, wild turkeys. Racoon, rabbits, squirrels and all different kinds of birds.The park offers several types of trails for hiking or walking or horse back riding.  The park Rangers are very versatile patrolling the park. Would recommend this park.

title: LOVE this park
content: Today was a beautiful experience at the park. We stopped at the lodge to visit the gift shop. They have delightful quilling cards and other unique items. At the front desk Tricia was very helpful as we were hiking. She showed us multiple hikes and gave us directions. We had done some research but she added the hike adjacent to the lodge which led us past the cabins and another marina. In addition we did the Sadbush and crowed paths with horses. The Stone House Loop and Hosak’s Cave were nice hikes too. Blue skies and kind fellow hikers made for an excellent day. Few people on the trails and all were patient and willing to share the views. There is an option to drive to the Stone House Loop. In normal times there is also a free canoe trip to the Stone House.  Better to look for that in 2021. The delightful caretaker at the Stone House was chatty with visitors. We struck up a conversation regarding the sun dial. The trails were all dry and easy to hike. Very little water in the creek bed of Hosak’s Cave and none coming over the falls as it has been dry lately. The hikes made for an amazing outdoor experience today. We packed a lunch and enjoyed a picnic too.

title: Beautiful
content: Great for hiking! We got engaged of one of the trails overlooking the water. The Lodge is clean with a big pool! The Lodge also does beautiful weddings!

title: Nice state park lake; great boating
content: We hiked a couple trails and the scenery is beautiful. My large family enjoyed the outdoors and all the things ha to do. If you are looking for camping, beaches, hiking, swimming, fishing, boating or kayaking there is plenty of that to do!

title: A return visit.
content: Huge lake with excellent boating and swimming off the boat. Plenty of places to pull boat off to the shore for a picnic. Looking forward to going back.

title: My paradise
content: Excellent place for camping. We have a 30 ft travel trailer and the sit accompanied it and had parking too. The online reservations were easy and checking was simple. Park is clean. The general store wasn’t open but there is a drive thru just down the road on SR22 heading towards Cambridge.

title: Great Place Till We Got Kicked Out
content: My favorite place to be. So many hiking trails. We boat here, swim here, fish here, and occasionally hunt here. It is just beautiful!

title: Not what I expected
content: We were supposed to go to the Florida Keys for Spring Break with the kids, instead we ended up here, because of the COVID scare. It was cold, rainy, and most places were shut down, but we made the most of it, because we were happy to go somewhere. The cabins are a lil dated, but nice. The view was just spectacular!! Make sure you book a cabin on the lake. Everything was fine, till we got kicked out, because the Govenor shut down the state park. So our 7 day vacation turned to 4 days. We will go back when everything gets back to normal.

title: Disappointed
content: I found a maggot in our bedroom, spiderwebs everywhere, patio was nasty, and a lot of stuff got damaged by other people staying in cabins. A $200 fishing pole got broken and a motor that was to be delivered on the day we left, got damaged pretty bad. It's an almost $3,000 motor! The manager refused to give us some free nights in exchange for a terrible experience. Not very happy. All they told us was to call odnr and make a report. Very mad about management and housekeeping 😡😡

title: Repairs and Updating Desperately Needed
content: The lake is great! Marinas are average because bathrooms are not kept clean. The lodge food is excellent. We stayed in Cabin 1 and it was filthy dirty with mold/mildew growing above the shower. For the price, I expect a place that I don’t have to clean myself. Docks for the cabins were substandard, wood could easily give you splinters and the black rubber was falling off the edge.  I would definitely stay away from the pet friendly cabins. Notwithstanding the subpar housekeeping and dock issues, had a great time with my family on our boats and sitting around the fire!

title: Dirty!
content: My mom and I are in cabin 9.  The cabin is horribly out-dated and needs repairs.  Also, the cabin counter and tabletop surfaces were dirty.  I was thankful I brought Lysol wipes and spray.  I am thankful to have a place to stay but feel like we may have made a bad choice.  The beds are comfortable.  There is everything you need in the kitchen: plates, bowls, glasses, silverware, coffee pot, toaster, and microwave.The view of the lake is fantastic but is blocked by the blinds in between the panes of glass that are broken.We’ll be here for a few more days because there is too much to load up and move.  I’m disappointed because I would expect better from a State Park.

title: Not following there own Covid safety measures
content: Cabins are horribly dirty. Oven kept stopping. Dead bugs on the ceiling in the kitchen! Windows have clearly never been cleaned.

title: Sneaky Thieves
content: They state that they have measures in place do to covid. However they don’t have any pool police or anyone monitoring the pool area. There were well over 50 people swimming although the sign stated the capacity was 25 more then half the people weren’t wearing bracelets they provide. The hot tub was a cesspool again patroons not following the measures put in place and no one monitoring. Very disappointed.

title: Lodge is nice. Cabins are in poor condition and Over Priced.
content: Definitely won't be coming back. Cabin we got had cable issues but the maintenance guys were awesome and there within minutes to fix it. Timbers restaurant was great and fast. Gave a 100% tip to the delivery girl. Cabin next to us was under construction so all we heard for 2 days was power tools and an air nail gun. Cabin on the other side of us had a big lezbo party taking up our parking spots instead of the visitor ones. Paid for the full stay when I booked...checked in and told I had a balance due, which I showed the clerk I didnt and she corrected it (form attached). Like a thief in the night, they debited the "remaining balance" after hours when I wouldn't notice it.....nice way to treat and steal from a highly decorated combat veteran. 👎👎👎👎

title: One of the worst places we’ve been
content: Grounds and lake are beautiful, lodge is well kept and very nice.  We, 4 adults,  stayed in a cabin. The location of the cabin on the lake was good, the fire ring was fun. The cabin itself was pretty bad. Small bathrom with a tiny shower, broken down couch, the hot tub was old, ugly, only one of us got in. It cost $634.00 after discount for 3 nights, way too much for condition of the cabin. If we go back we would try the rooms in the lodge.

title: Save your money!
content: The play grounds in the camping area are minimal. The best playset is by the office which is a 10 minute drive from our site. The bathrooms & shower houses were filthy. The camp sites were level with mature trees spread out. They had hiking trails that were nicely maintained. The beach area was covered in goose poop. The boat ramp by the waters edge was so slick. My dad fell then my husband & I trying to help him. We’ve been boating our whole lives & have never seen anything like that dangerous ramp. A poor mans truck slipped & ran him over!  We won’t be back.

title: So very disappointed
content: I was very disappointed in my recent trip to Salt Fork Lodge. I stayed in the lodge with my kids and my sister stayed in a cabin with her kids. The lodge and cabins are extremely outdated and in need of major updates and repairs. In the lodge, there was limited hot water and water pressure for showering and the hair dryer was barely hot enough to dry my hair. Many things were broken or closed. The arcade games and token machines were often malfunctioning. The nature center was closed the entire time we were there.  The lodge has one restaurant, a snack shop by the pool and a bar area. The restaurant hours listed on website were not the same hours of operation which really messed with our lunch plans prior to our departure. The wifi in the lodge and cabins was spotty and extremely slow. There is nothing close by-things to do or restaurants. In addition, I felt both the lodge, rooms and other areas, and the cabins were in need of a deep cleaning. I would have loved to share my feedback online to the resort, but I did not seen any option for customer feedback on the website. Despite all the disappointments, the kids still managed to have a good time. The price charged for both the lodge and cabins in their current conditions is outrageous. Unfortunately, this will be our last trip here. Not worth the time or money!

title: Not what I expected
content: Let me start this review by saying I used to love Salt Fork. Used to be my most favorite place to go. The lodge is beautiful, the beach nice and big and the many hiking trails absolutely amazing. Every year on July 4th my family and I plan a trip to Salt Fork to picnic and enjoy the day. Usually we drive to the picnic area and eat, then pack everything back up and drive to the beach. So when I was browsing the website and saw that the park had installed two new picnic shelters at the beach that you could reserve for the day, I quickly reserved one 3 days in advance. My family and I we're very excited and really looking forward to our trip today. We got to the park and loaded up our picnic gear and made the long trek from the beach parking lot to the rental shelters. In 90 degree heat, with a infant, and all the baby gear that a day out with a infant requires. So needless to say that when we turned the bend and came up upon our rental shelter and saw it full of people with the grill going fulling enjoying the shelter at our expense of $53, we were beyond upset. There we are standing there with all our gear, in 90 degree sun with the baby and are left to confront the people on our own as there was no park ranger anywhere to be seen. Long story short they were not happy and sat there and continued about their griking and eating while we stood there. Finally after about 30 minutes they decided to vacate and left all of their trash there for us. It completely ruined our day. If this were not bad enough, we tried to salvage the couple hours we had left, and cleaned up their mess and tried to enjoy what we could. Wasn't long before cars were driving through the grass all around us asking us to use our shelter. It was completely miserable. I'm absolutely sure that cars are not allowed to be driven on the grass and the beach. But we counted more than 10 doing this. I wish at this point I could say that was the extent of our miserable day but no. The climax came when a pick up truck full of drunk people backed up to our shelter and literally TOOK one of our picnic tables. Literally picked it up and put it into the back of their truck and drove away with it. It was at this point that we had had enough and packed up and left. A complete waste of $53 and an entire day. It saddens my heart to say that what was once my favorite place, has really gone downhill. There is no law enforcement at all there anymore. If you're going to rent out picnic shelters and charge people hard earned money for them, then you need someone there to enforce and monitor the use of them. At the very least place a reserved sign on them. There also definitely needs to be a park ranger at the beach. People are just doing whatever they please down there with no consequences. It's not a safe family place anymore and it saddens me to say that we most likely will not be back.

title: Disappointed
content: I found a maggot in our bedroom, spiderwebs everywhere, patio was nasty, and a lot of stuff got damaged by other people staying in cabins. A $200 fishing pole got broken and a motor that was to be delivered on the day we left, got damaged pretty bad. It's an almost $3,000 motor! The manager refused to give us some free nights in exchange for a terrible experience. Not very happy. All they told us was to call odnr and make a report. Very mad about management and housekeeping 😡😡

title: Repairs and Updating Desperately Needed
content: The lake is great! Marinas are average because bathrooms are not kept clean. The lodge food is excellent. We stayed in Cabin 1 and it was filthy dirty with mold/mildew growing above the shower. For the price, I expect a place that I don’t have to clean myself. Docks for the cabins were substandard, wood could easily give you splinters and the black rubber was falling off the edge.  I would definitely stay away from the pet friendly cabins. Notwithstanding the subpar housekeeping and dock issues, had a great time with my family on our boats and sitting around the fire!

title: Dirty!
content: My mom and I are in cabin 9.  The cabin is horribly out-dated and needs repairs.  Also, the cabin counter and tabletop surfaces were dirty.  I was thankful I brought Lysol wipes and spray.  I am thankful to have a place to stay but feel like we may have made a bad choice.  The beds are comfortable.  There is everything you need in the kitchen: plates, bowls, glasses, silverware, coffee pot, toaster, and microwave.The view of the lake is fantastic but is blocked by the blinds in between the panes of glass that are broken.We’ll be here for a few more days because there is too much to load up and move.  I’m disappointed because I would expect better from a State Park.

title: Not following there own Covid safety measures
content: Cabins are horribly dirty. Oven kept stopping. Dead bugs on the ceiling in the kitchen! Windows have clearly never been cleaned.

title: Sneaky Thieves
content: They state that they have measures in place do to covid. However they don’t have any pool police or anyone monitoring the pool area. There were well over 50 people swimming although the sign stated the capacity was 25 more then half the people weren’t wearing bracelets they provide. The hot tub was a cesspool again patroons not following the measures put in place and no one monitoring. Very disappointed.

title: Lodge is nice. Cabins are in poor condition and Over Priced.
content: Definitely won't be coming back. Cabin we got had cable issues but the maintenance guys were awesome and there within minutes to fix it. Timbers restaurant was great and fast. Gave a 100% tip to the delivery girl. Cabin next to us was under construction so all we heard for 2 days was power tools and an air nail gun. Cabin on the other side of us had a big lezbo party taking up our parking spots instead of the visitor ones. Paid for the full stay when I booked...checked in and told I had a balance due, which I showed the clerk I didnt and she corrected it (form attached). Like a thief in the night, they debited the "remaining balance" after hours when I wouldn't notice it.....nice way to treat and steal from a highly decorated combat veteran. 👎👎👎👎

title: One of the worst places we’ve been
content: Grounds and lake are beautiful, lodge is well kept and very nice.  We, 4 adults,  stayed in a cabin. The location of the cabin on the lake was good, the fire ring was fun. The cabin itself was pretty bad. Small bathrom with a tiny shower, broken down couch, the hot tub was old, ugly, only one of us got in. It cost $634.00 after discount for 3 nights, way too much for condition of the cabin. If we go back we would try the rooms in the lodge.

title: Save your money!
content: The play grounds in the camping area are minimal. The best playset is by the office which is a 10 minute drive from our site. The bathrooms & shower houses were filthy. The camp sites were level with mature trees spread out. They had hiking trails that were nicely maintained. The beach area was covered in goose poop. The boat ramp by the waters edge was so slick. My dad fell then my husband & I trying to help him. We’ve been boating our whole lives & have never seen anything like that dangerous ramp. A poor mans truck slipped & ran him over!  We won’t be back.

title: So very disappointed
content: I was very disappointed in my recent trip to Salt Fork Lodge. I stayed in the lodge with my kids and my sister stayed in a cabin with her kids. The lodge and cabins are extremely outdated and in need of major updates and repairs. In the lodge, there was limited hot water and water pressure for showering and the hair dryer was barely hot enough to dry my hair. Many things were broken or closed. The arcade games and token machines were often malfunctioning. The nature center was closed the entire time we were there.  The lodge has one restaurant, a snack shop by the pool and a bar area. The restaurant hours listed on website were not the same hours of operation which really messed with our lunch plans prior to our departure. The wifi in the lodge and cabins was spotty and extremely slow. There is nothing close by-things to do or restaurants. In addition, I felt both the lodge, rooms and other areas, and the cabins were in need of a deep cleaning. I would have loved to share my feedback online to the resort, but I did not seen any option for customer feedback on the website. Despite all the disappointments, the kids still managed to have a good time. The price charged for both the lodge and cabins in their current conditions is outrageous. Unfortunately, this will be our last trip here. Not worth the time or money!

title: Buyer beware!
content: Let me start this review by saying I used to love Salt Fork. Used to be my most favorite place to go. The lodge is beautiful, the beach nice and big and the many hiking trails absolutely amazing. Every year on July 4th my family and I plan a trip to Salt Fork to picnic and enjoy the day. Usually we drive to the picnic area and eat, then pack everything back up and drive to the beach. So when I was browsing the website and saw that the park had installed two new picnic shelters at the beach that you could reserve for the day, I quickly reserved one 3 days in advance. My family and I we're very excited and really looking forward to our trip today. We got to the park and loaded up our picnic gear and made the long trek from the beach parking lot to the rental shelters. In 90 degree heat, with a infant, and all the baby gear that a day out with a infant requires. So needless to say that when we turned the bend and came up upon our rental shelter and saw it full of people with the grill going fulling enjoying the shelter at our expense of $53, we were beyond upset. There we are standing there with all our gear, in 90 degree sun with the baby and are left to confront the people on our own as there was no park ranger anywhere to be seen. Long story short they were not happy and sat there and continued about their griking and eating while we stood there. Finally after about 30 minutes they decided to vacate and left all of their trash there for us. It completely ruined our day. If this were not bad enough, we tried to salvage the couple hours we had left, and cleaned up their mess and tried to enjoy what we could. Wasn't long before cars were driving through the grass all around us asking us to use our shelter. It was completely miserable. I'm absolutely sure that cars are not allowed to be driven on the grass and the beach. But we counted more than 10 doing this. I wish at this point I could say that was the extent of our miserable day but no. The climax came when a pick up truck full of drunk people backed up to our shelter and literally TOOK one of our picnic tables. Literally picked it up and put it into the back of their truck and drove away with it. It was at this point that we had had enough and packed up and left. A complete waste of $53 and an entire day. It saddens my heart to say that what was once my favorite place, has really gone downhill. There is no law enforcement at all there anymore. If you're going to rent out picnic shelters and charge people hard earned money for them, then you need someone there to enforce and monitor the use of them. At the very least place a reserved sign on them. There also definitely needs to be a park ranger at the beach. People are just doing whatever they please down there with no consequences. It's not a safe family place anymore and it saddens me to say that we most likely will not be back.

title: Poorly Maintained Trails
content: This lodge is in need of renovations. Its one of the oldest Ohio State Park lodges. I hope you pay with a credit card because cash/debit card transactions are a veritable nightmare! We got overcharged to the tune of $500.00 and it took over a week to get the money back. I also asked to speak with a manager in regards to this issue, and was never even called back. Unfortunately this is the second time it has happened at an Ohio State Park lodge this year. This will be the last time we will be staying with them.

title: Rude people and poorly maintained
content: There were helpful friendly folks at the welcome areas that gave us a map & told us where we could park & to expect steep inclines down to the lake and back, which was all good advice. But when we attempted a trail, it was horrendous; not well marked (just spray painted arrows on trees), overgrown, nettles and thorns everywhere!! Like no one had walked them in years. Trees had fallen and the trail now just went over or around them, nothing was cleared. We gave up & turned around partway down one trail, then had the same experience down the second trail. We gave up on the idea of hiking, then drove down to the lake beach, which was what we were trying to reach anyway! The beach was tidy & well maintained fortunately. For Ohio's largest state park however we had higher expectations overall.

title: Road are in rough shape
content: Tried to see the meteor shower but a bunch of campers left their brightest lights on all night. When asked the next day, they told me to drive miles to somewhere else where it might be dark.  They were not going to turn off their lights. Tried to hike the trails but the brambles have overgrown the trails. Bathrooms dirty and showers are a hike away. Disappointing!

title: cabin in terrible need of cleaning and maintenance
content: Stayed at the lodge a base point for motorcycle rides in the area and it was long ride on a rough road into the park. Not much is nearby. I would not visit there again as there was not much else to do.

title: Couldn't find anything
content: I have stayed in much nicer accommodations for less.  Dirty, crooked door that would not close, missing lock, tv cable laying on top of ground outside was a trip hazard.  Who's running this place? Don't they ever get out of the office and look at what they are responsible for?

title: Rating for the BEACH AREA only.    Totally disgusting.
content: We were not the only ones.  Nothing if marked, and could not find anything.  Left before we got lost in this maze if nothing.  We here it is great for horse back riders, but beyond that it was a total waste of our time.

title: Horribly Boring Park
content: I have always loved Salt Fork and have been there many times in the past camping, staying in a cabin and just a day of boating and visiting the beach.  Great fishing there!   I haven't been there in a while and decided to stop by for a picnic and swim after a day at The Wilds.  The grounds are still gorgeous and it's so beautiful there.  We even got to see some deer run across the road while driving to the beach.  Now that I have a family and young children I thought have fun it would be to let them experience some wonderful memories that I had.  We definitely made some memories. . . .  but ones we would rather not remember.First, we got to the beach area.  A place that I used to have a lot of fun at.  Things looked okay, the parking lot looked run down along with their putt putt but hey, things happen.  Budget cuts, etc, etc.   We couldn't find a grill at the beach so we drove around and finally found a grill and no grates in it.  I believe they were even chained down but still stolen somehow.    So we went back to the beach and changed into our suits.  My boys came out of the mens restroom and said how nasty it was.  Well,  there aren't many mens restrooms that don't smell so I brushed it off.  What came next was a sight that I won't forget.  I went into the womens restroom and WOW!, right in the middle of the entrance walkway to the bathroom was a big pile of feces, YES, HUMAN FECES that was obviously stepped in (hopefully on accident) and smeared all over the inside of the restroom.  It was horrible.  I can't believe it's still there on a Sunday late afternoon at 4:30pm.  It was there for a while, possibly the day before.  Lets just say the flies were having a field day.  So, I stepped over the big pile (not exaggerating) tipped toed around the smears and proceeded into the bathroom.   Went into a stall, no toilet paper.  Went into another stall, toilet paper but to my surprise a big feminine pad laying on the back of the toilet.  Disgusting people!   Finally I found a 'clean'  stall and went to wash my hands. . . . no soap!  Another little girl was trying to find soap and said how nasty the bathroom was.On my way exiting the bathroom I must have been talking too loud to myself saying how disgusting this bathroom was and three ladies overheard me and completely agreed.  They haven't been there in years and said they won't be back.  One told me how they were swimming and felt something on their foot and brought up a tampon and feminine pad from the water.  GROSS!   I was hoping it was a one time fluke but somehow I knew the horror wasn't over yet but I tried to be positive and get the bathroom out of my mind. My younger son, 9 yrs old, and I proceeded to the water and he wanted to dig for shells.  We were in knee deep water and on about the 6th scoop of rocks and dirt he brought up from the bottom was. . . you guessed it. . . a BIG FEMININE PAD!   What the hell?  I was hoping it wasn't what I thought it was.   I told him it was trash, put it down right away and lets get out to get cleaned up.  I'm not a clean freak but not this is over the top.  We got out, got dressed and off we went.  My kids were so bummed but how coincidental and disgusting it was to find that within 10 minutes of swimming.  That's enough of the beach for me.  If I ever return, it will be for boating and that's it. Enjoy the scenery but don't go in the beach area.  I almost took a photo but couldn't bring myself to look at any of the mess a 2nd time.

title: Great retreat
content: There is no bike trails AT ALL!  None!  Unless you like swimming in a private beach covered in goose poop, or a public beach that looks like an abandoned murder mystery, there isn't much else to do.  We left a night early and have been waiting for our refund.  That was 4 months ago!  Not a good experience at all.  Nothing good to say about this park.

title: "Very disappointed"
content: WE recently had a family reunion at Salt Fork State Park in Ohio. The park was beautiful and so quiet. Our very nice room had a small balcony which overlooked the lake. In the mornings thedeer were right out there playing for us to enjoy. The service was fantastic. We had rented the Morgan room that was very clean and nicely set up. On Friday we had a pizza party and the gal who set it up was so helpful and friendly. On Saturday we needed some extra tables and ice.The staff provided it quickly and told us to let them know if anything else was needed. The Pool (outside) was fabulous. We didn't get much hiking down because of time limitations but hope to go back.

title: 꼭 가보세요!
content: 반면 그러죠 한결제 로 교회, 박물관 및 전시회 나 는 다시 보내는 일부 엘리트 로 케임브리지 대학 에서 비용 에 라운드 쿼드.만약 대학 느끼 ㄹ 수 있 는 부유 이렇게 훌륭히한 유지 의무 를 하 ㄹ 때 유리 crumbing 구빈구 교회 - 하지만 그들 은 상태 - 그래서 저 한테 세금 보험 여 두 번 지불 - 당신 말 대로 larf 을

title: 하루 날잡아서 갔다오기 정말 좋네요
content: 영국에 머무는 중 가장 좋았던 캠브리지! 특히 비오는 날의 캠브리지는 풍경도, 날씨도, 커피도 가장 영국스러웠어요. 캠브리지는 꼭 가보세요!

title: 캠브리지 대학
content: 런던하고는 날씨도 그리고 분위기도 다릅니다. 정말 좋네요. 고풍스런 대학교와 여유로운 분위기 영국의 지성이 달리 높은게 아니네요. 공부가 절로 될듯

title: 캠퍼스 내 보트 타기
content: 저는 주요 대학 건물을 보기 위해king's parade에서 길 따라 한바퀴를 돌아서 모두 구경했어요.별다른 동선은 없으니 각자의 스타일대로 돌아서 보면 될 것 같아요.

title: 역사와 건축
content: 캠브리지 대학교는 런던에서 50 마일 떨어진 케임브리지에있는 대학 연구 대학입니다. 1209 년에 설립되었습니다.캠브리지는 두 번째로 오래된 대학입니다 (이 영어권 세계에서).캠퍼스는 거대하고 동문은 가이드 워킹 투어와 보트 투어를 조직합니다.음식 마구간은 많고 음식 맛있습니다.

title: 멋진 건물
content: 유서 깊은 건물과 대학을 돌아 다니는 것이 환상적입니다. 건축 스타일의 범위는 인상적이며 다양한 박물관에 포함 된 역사는 실망스럽지 않습니다. 공부하고 살기 좋은 곳입니다.

title: 캠브리지 대학교의 멋진 가이드 투어
content: 케임브리지 대학교의 건축물, 안마당 및 부지는 다른 것입니다. 각기 다른 방식으로 멋진 건물이 있습니다.

title: 케임브리지 대학 주변의 훌륭한 개인 여행
content: 캠브리지 대학교를 방문하기 위해 가이드 여행에 갔다. 투어 가이드에는 역사, 흥미로운 이벤트 및 유명한 대학교 학생들이 있습니다. 건물, 안뜰 및 River Cam은 lovely했습니다. 우리는했다. 또는 폭우로 인해 수위가 높아 강 캠에서 펀트를 할 수 있습니다. 방문하고보아야합니다.

title: 매우 훌륭한 Kinga Collage
content: 즐겁고 유익한 경험이나 개인 여행을 찾았습니다. Dick Matthews 우리 가이드는 우리에게 놀랍게도 Kings 대학을 포함하는 정통하고 잘 조직 된 여행을 줬다. 이 역사적인 도시에 대해 더 알고 싶은 캠브리지 방문객에게 적극 권장합니다.

title: 케임브리지는 놀랍습니다!
content: 아름답게 위치한 대학, 기념비, 넓은 정원 및 오랜 역사를 자랑하는 웅장한 건물입니다. 한번 볼 가치가 있습니다.

title: 얼마나 아이러니한
content: 12 월 19 일 케임브리지와 케임브리지 대학교를 방문했습니다. 아름다운 도시, 멋진 대학, 그리고 King 's College Chapell은 훌륭합니다. 나는 높은 문화와 교육의 느낌에 놀랄 것이라고 기대하지 않았으며, 또한 대학 도시에서 왔습니다. 그러나 케임브리지 대학교는 장소 그 자체보다 더 많은 경험입니다. 유감스럽게도 Cambridge University Library를 방문 할 수 없습니다. 나는 또한 대학 도서관에서 일하기 때문에 경험은 독특했을 것입니다.

title: 아닌지..
content: 나는 이곳을 즐기지 않았다. 킹스 게이트키퍼를 매우 무례하고 대학교 앞에. 단지를 착용하지 않은 목욕 가운을 교수. 무료 교육 홍보 는 어떻게 전 세계 대학을 방문하는 아이러니한 지불해야 한다.

title: 정말 바가지
content: 여러번 방문한 캠브리지. 나의 마지막 방문은. 첫째, 운전 기사가 무례하고 오만한 공원과 타고. 둘째, 주위를 산책하고 끊임없이 질문을 부딪히 리뼈관. 을 다녀오고, 괜찮습니다, 나는 버스 투어/도보 투어 완료할 수 있습니다. 셋째, 아리마를 느낌을 아주 조금 인종 차별 채식주의자.

title: Absolutely mezzmerized by the quantity of different butterflies
content: Compared to what you pay to visit Toronto Zoo, admission to this must be FREE! This doesn't let me finish before i have typed 100 characters but there is not really anything more so say.

title: Great space for a visit
content: The conservatory has a prepurchase off site ticket sales programe, however we just went as walk ins at 11 m , no problemI suggest you buy the inexpensive butterfly guide on front counter  about $1.25. Be prepared for an amazing visit from the butterflies. There are 2 other rooms of artifacts and live spiders :). Onsite are veery clean washrooms and a dining restauraunt , very reasonabley priced

title: Isn’t nature beautiful?
content: Great cafe and outdoor area as well. Worth the time to see if there is a school visit scheduled as you plan. Wear bright colours or floral patterns as some butterflies landed on people or came closer to check you out.It is hot and humid so dress accordingly. Gift shop worth a visit also.

title: Loved IT!!
content: A lovely place to spend an afternoon. Been visiting for over 20 years with my son. A special memory every time. If you’re lucky enough to go on a quieter day, the environment is so lovely you could spend several hours just watching the butterflies and birds in the solarium.  We’re lucky to have such a gem here in this area!

title: Definitely worth it if in the area
content: This was the second time we have been to the butterfly conservatory.  The first time was in 2005 when my children were little.  It was still as enjoyable in 2022 as it was in 2005.

title: A wonderful experience for everyone!
content: Really enjoyed our visit. It wasn’t too crowded, which helped.  There are two rooms full of live insects, amphibians, scorpions, etc, in cases……these are very well done, with lots of good info.  Also some dead creatures in cases.  Some really amazing creatures on display!  Then the huge butterfly and bird space.   A great variety of butterflies, birds, even some fish and we saw a turtle in the water. Staff was friendly.  It was not too hot, probably around 80 degrees. Beautiful plants and water features, and you can walk behind a waterfall. Our kids loved getting within inches of a very relaxed quail who was walking around. Lots of benches to sit and enjoy the serenity. There is a cafe, which we did not use. Entrance is fairly expensive……$8 for kids and $20 for adults. We were there for 90 minutes. All in all, a very enjoyable time for kids and adults.

title: Borboletário
content: What a wonderful experience! Many beautiful butterflies flying around in and open concept. A tropical garden with a pond and waterfall. Butterflies all over flying near you and sometimes they will rest on your clothes. Fun for children!

title: Visit the Tropics!
content: Adorei visitar!Muitas espécies, ambiente agradável e a parte do borboleta achei maravilhosa.Uma réplica de floresta, cheia de espécies de borboletas, soltas, que voam entre os visitantes.Que experiência maravilhosa!

title: Love this place, visit yearly.
content: We walked into the tropics surrounded by birds snd butterflies. It was magical! So much to see and learn and photograph. Our cameras needed to acclimatize before the lenses would stop fogging up. The staff was exceptional with a shout out to Nicole for her professionalism in a variety of circumstances. Don’t leave without visiting the hissing cockroach display at the front desk! Two hours well spent, went by too quickly!

title: Anniversary day activity
content: We've been going here for a few years now with our small kids. Beautiful place, great way to kill some time with kiddos, very affordable.

title: Absolutely mezzmerized by the quantity of different butterflies
content: I love butterflies and seeing them reminds me of my late Mother. My husband took me here on our anniversary and we absolutely loved it! Beautiful tropical feeling and amazing butterflies landed on me! Very friendly staff and COVID precautions are appreciated! Highly recommended!

title: Great space for a visit
content: The conservatory has a prepurchase off site ticket sales programe, however we just went as walk ins at 11 m , no problemI suggest you buy the inexpensive butterfly guide on front counter  about $1.25. Be prepared for an amazing visit from the butterflies. There are 2 other rooms of artifacts and live spiders :). Onsite are veery clean washrooms and a dining restauraunt , very reasonabley priced

title: Isn’t nature beautiful?
content: Great cafe and outdoor area as well. Worth the time to see if there is a school visit scheduled as you plan. Wear bright colours or floral patterns as some butterflies landed on people or came closer to check you out.It is hot and humid so dress accordingly. Gift shop worth a visit also.

title: Loved IT!!
content: A lovely place to spend an afternoon. Been visiting for over 20 years with my son. A special memory every time. If you’re lucky enough to go on a quieter day, the environment is so lovely you could spend several hours just watching the butterflies and birds in the solarium.  We’re lucky to have such a gem here in this area!

title: Definitely worth it if in the area
content: This was the second time we have been to the butterfly conservatory.  The first time was in 2005 when my children were little.  It was still as enjoyable in 2022 as it was in 2005.

title: A wonderful experience for everyone!
content: Really enjoyed our visit. It wasn’t too crowded, which helped.  There are two rooms full of live insects, amphibians, scorpions, etc, in cases……these are very well done, with lots of good info.  Also some dead creatures in cases.  Some really amazing creatures on display!  Then the huge butterfly and bird space.   A great variety of butterflies, birds, even some fish and we saw a turtle in the water. Staff was friendly.  It was not too hot, probably around 80 degrees. Beautiful plants and water features, and you can walk behind a waterfall. Our kids loved getting within inches of a very relaxed quail who was walking around. Lots of benches to sit and enjoy the serenity. There is a cafe, which we did not use. Entrance is fairly expensive……$8 for kids and $20 for adults. We were there for 90 minutes. All in all, a very enjoyable time for kids and adults.

title: Borboletário
content: What a wonderful experience! Many beautiful butterflies flying around in and open concept. A tropical garden with a pond and waterfall. Butterflies all over flying near you and sometimes they will rest on your clothes. Fun for children!

title: Visit the Tropics!
content: Adorei visitar!Muitas espécies, ambiente agradável e a parte do borboleta achei maravilhosa.Uma réplica de floresta, cheia de espécies de borboletas, soltas, que voam entre os visitantes.Que experiência maravilhosa!

title: Love this place, visit yearly.
content: We walked into the tropics surrounded by birds snd butterflies. It was magical! So much to see and learn and photograph. Our cameras needed to acclimatize before the lenses would stop fogging up. The staff was exceptional with a shout out to Nicole for her professionalism in a variety of circumstances. Don’t leave without visiting the hissing cockroach display at the front desk! Two hours well spent, went by too quickly!

title: Anniversary day activity
content: We've been going here for a few years now with our small kids. Beautiful place, great way to kill some time with kiddos, very affordable.

title: Are we in Costa Rica?
content: I love butterflies and seeing them reminds me of my late Mother. My husband took me here on our anniversary and we absolutely loved it! Beautiful tropical feeling and amazing butterflies landed on me! Very friendly staff and COVID precautions are appreciated! Highly recommended!

title: Butterfly Conservatory
content: Wow! Amazing place! We were warmly greeted by a front desk employee for our 2pm time slot. The facility promotes safe distance with sanitizing stations throughout. We were given the choice to visit the butterflies or insects first. Two rooms filled with living crickets, roaches, spiders, bees, frogs, etc. Both educational and entertaining. The butterflies, birds and plants were lovely. We felt transported to Costa Rica. Staff are friendly and approachable ready to educate and answer questions. Sitting on benches watching the butterflies flutter around was so peaceful. Some tickled us when they landed on our arms and head. We purchased wonderful souvenirs from the gift shop. Will try the cafe next time. Impressive property!

title: Beautiful
content: Entering into the garden was as if you were in a movie, a magical and tropical paradise...you hear water running birds chirping and because it was winter, you had summer vibes👌

title: Hot, humid and majestic
content: Wow! what a wonderful place . I have been approximately 8 times. My father and I used to love to go and just enjoy all the plants and wonderful butterflies. Great Memories ! Staff are very knowledgable. Such a great place to take kids to learn about nature. I highly recommend

title: A Day Trip
content: There are hundreds of butterflies fluttering about you (or landing on you), exotic birds at your feet and cool exhibits to learn about all the creatures. The passion from the staff offering information, tours and helping you interact with the creatures is a definite plus. We learned so much and were amazed by the learning centres where you could see butterflies emerging from their cocoons or enjoying a tray of sweet treats. The critters were all well cared for and enjoying a beautiful habitat. We spent about an hour looking around and then we visited the lovely gift shop (something for everyone) and enjoyed a light lunch at the spacious cafe. Pleasantly surprised by the experience.

title: An out of the way Gem!
content: Filled with tropical plants with wheel chair accessibility around waterfalls and rock gardens. We viewed over a few dozen different butterflies fluttering around us within the hour. There’s also a cafe and gift shops available.

title: Monarch tagging
content: This has become a standard for our daughter & grandchildren on Family Day.  The kids (and adults apparently) love watching the butterflies and birds flitter about among the plants & trees.  Take your camera and have your kids wear something with a brightly coloured flower and there is a good chance a butterfly will land.  There are lots of other things (insects / bugs etc) to see also and there is a small cafe there to satisfy most people.

title: Great place to visit -especially in winter
content: I love butterflies and to be able to tag a butterfly before it migrates to Mexico was amazing. We were also able to attend a very informative info session! Can't wait to go back in December for the Flight of white.

title: September Wedding
content: While it’s small, it’s a really interesting place to visit with a huge number of butterflies. They land on you which is quite cool. The facility is beautiful with its water and tropical plants and a warm retreat in the dead of winter.

title: Very Zen!
content: we held our daughter's wedding at the Butterfly conservatory in early September. They were absolutely fantastic and helping us to organize both the ceremony in the greenhouse, and the dinner afterwards in their cafeteria. It was transformed into a beautiful setting for the dinner and we had plenty of room for dancing after the tables were cleared. I would highly recommend this as an alternative wedding venue for anyone!

title: Nice but very small
content: What a lovely place to visit. Tropical environment and so full of colour. Benches scattered throughout so you can sit and take it all in. So many different butterflies and birds, none of them seem timid with the human visitors. In fact the butterflies may even land on you(It’s just a tickle!). Staff are knowledgeable and readily share information about the types and phases of the butterflies. Beautiful colours and intricate patterns, Mother Nature is amazing and you can it all up close and personal.

title: Annoying day trip
content: I recently took my kids to the Cambridge Butterfly Conservatory. My kids had a good time but I found it very expensive for the amount of time and entertainment inside. The conservatory part where the butterflies are is beautiful but small. We spent a total of 1.5 hours there and I think that is the absolute most amount of time you could do. What they have is done well BUT for the cost of entry it is not worth it, I hope they expand their facility or offer some kind of enhanced program for kids in the future to give you more value for your money.

title: Boring
content: This was our family's fifth visit. I take my children every March Break. The walkthrough rainforest portion is lovely and vaguely educational.This year we were annoyed right out of the gate, as we came prepared with an Attractions Ontario coupon that was not honoured. 2 coupons came together, 1 with an expiry date and 1 without, and we were advised that the expiry date was intended to apply to both. We paid over $50 for 2 adults and 2 children, ridiculous for just over an hour of entertainment.While we waited in line to pay, we noticed other families simply walk around the line and directly in. No one was controlling the pushing and chaos of the entrance area. No one provided proof of whether or not they paid the high entry fee.Further, the entire Cambridge Butterfly Conservatory was far too packed to read or enjoy anything. Attendance limits are too high, if they exist. We often couldn't move and just hung around waiting, overly hot, being jostled by those guests who pushed through the crowds. Very unpleasant visit with young children.Strollers should not be allowed in this attraction. I say this as a parent of 3. Wear them in a carrier or don't come. There is no room for strollers on the narrow paths.Although signs are posted everywhere about not touching the butterflies or birds, again the total lack of enforcement meant I observed this rule repeatedly broken. The bathrooms were filthy and generally wet, without paper towels to dry. We have enjoyed this location in the past, during the school holiday. For some reason the Cambridge Butterfly Conservatory was simply unprepared to contain the crowd this year. We are unlikely to visit again, at this price, with this level of chaos.

title: Not worth the price of admission
content: Boring place to be. Yes the butterflies are neat to see but it wouldn’t be a place I would travel to go see.

title: HIGHLY OVER PRICED
content: This was our first visit and unfortunately it takes 10 minutes to go through once.   We have a 3 year old that we had to pay for?    Maybe under 5 free makes more sense.

title: a great place to visit
content: Took my two grand daughters there (ages 3 and 7) and was totally shocked after paying over $31.00+ at how short and boring it is in there.  You can only walk around so many times, even they were disappointed!

title: Worst waste of money
content: one a bus trip with 50 seniors, they gave us nice cool place to sit down and told us all about butterflies.  Where they winter, what they eat and what should we plant for them. Very informative information. Lots of dead butterflies to see and read about. The best part of the butterflies is going in and walking around with all the beautiful butterflies flying aroud us. So colorful and beautiful. They land on plants so you can get a good look at them. Next we went to the flower nursery, fabulous flowers, plants and great service. I bought a beautiful Hosta called Remember Me. This is a great place for all ages to visit

title: Very small
content: I took my family here and spent well over $50 for us to go in, 10 minutes later I walked out. Nothing wrong with the facility except that it is soo small. They need to make it bigger and have more stuff to look at. As I said before worst way to spend $50!

title: save your money
content: Very small conservatory.  You can literally walk through it within 5 min. It wasn't really worth the money.

title: Exorbitant fee
content: I have 4 kids ages 5,7 12 and 13.  they were ready to leave about 15 minutes after getting to the museum.  I had to drive an hour to get there! not worht the drive or the money.

title: Fiddler On The Roof
content: We saw Les Mis here and I was so disappointed! The structure is cold and the theatre is typical. There are so many better theatre designs out there! I wonder about the acoustics as well, as it is a small theatre, yet all the actors used microphones. Also, there were many people on the patio at intermission, yet no garbages and no place for cigarette butts.

title: Wonderful!
content: Great show. Wonderful voices and a storyline which is applicable today. Enjoyed by entire family including A 9 and 11 year Olds.

title: A fantastic show and the actors were superb even Santa Claus !!!
content: Because of timing and other commitments, 3 of us went to a Matinee not expecting the same experience as the glitz of an evening performance. We were very happily surprised and thrilled with the performance, the singing, the amazing dancing, and the props. We got teary-eyed in the same places, and were sad when the show was over.  Kudos to those actors who can give such performances time-after-time and whether for a matinee or not. It was special.It was extra nice to come out into the dark to see the Christmas decorating of the Gaslight District and to enjoy a wonderful dinner at the Foundry Tavern. With everything being so close together, it made for a very fun time for us and we'd do it again in a heartbeat.

title: Fantastic local talent
content: The show was absolutely fantastic and Alex is performing superbly as the days go on!!Merry Christmas to all

title: Spectacular Show....Fiddler
content: We frequent the Hamilton theatre as well the St Jacobs playhouse often. We try to see almost every show produced. The acting, producing, stage props, music are fantastic! We are always so elated when we leave the shows! Always anxiously awaiting for the next show! No need to go to those high priced Toronto shows! Support local & be wowed!

title: Super good experience!!!
content: Went to Fiddler. A wonderful performance. Sets were grand. Players were great especially Alex. Teriffic venue.Will be getting Jersey Boys tickets.

title: Fantastic entertainment!
content: Another fantastic Drayton show!!!Captivating from start to finish!!! The music, the singing, the acting, the dancing: everything just superb!!!Thank you Drayton entertainment!!!!

title: Fantastic, like all the shows we see at Drayton.
content: We have enjoyed every Drayton performance we have attended. The talent is amazing! We have not been to all the venues, but all the ones we have are exceptional.

title: Drayton Entertainment's Kinky Boots... The Most Beautiful Musical in the world!
content: Another terrific performance!  The cast was wonderful. Evita and Che gave great performances.  The singing was phenomenal.  Saw this in Toronto in the 80s so the story never grows old.

title: WONDERFUL experience!
content: Just when I thought David Connolly couldn’t surprise or delight me more with his Incomparable brilliance as Director & Choreographer, he proved me wrong with Kinky Boots!! I was blessed to have seen it at the Hamilton Family Theatre on opening night and closing matinee.  I now understand why people have seen it multiple times!  Because of this production, this has become my all-time favourite musical!   From the moment the curtain rose, I was captivated and hooked to the very last musical note and last surprise red streamer falling on me!  I would give this production Endless Stars because it was WOW and had something for everyone. It was a smorgasbord for the senses from the superb and talented cast and crew, to the gorgeous costumes, makeup on Jos and the Angels, set designs, and unforgettable musical score which I cannot stop listening to! Everyone was brilliant in it, but for me, Jos N. Banks and Sayer Roberts’ chemistry and poignant acting did it for me!  They were THE PERFECT Lola/Simon and Charlie. Jos had a powerful and "larger than life" stage presence which took my breath away!  I LOVED all the dance numbers especially with the Angels which were insanely fast-paced, flawlessly executed, and in all those fabulous heels, no less!!!  Thank you, Angels, for inspiring me to improve my daily exercise routine; I aim to be as fit as you and to achieve those killer legs!  :o) I LOVED seeing many of my favourite Drayton regulars like Jackie, Blythe, AJ, George, Trayvon, Alyssa, Cassel, Stephanie, and Andrew take on new roles and showcasing the endless talents they have as well as being introduced to new actors. This production felt like attending a long-awaited family reunion and I am super thankful I was there for it! Thank YOU, Alex, David, Gary Good, Drayton Entertainment staff and volunteers for always welcoming me with a smile and for sharing and spreading Love, Joy, Laughter, Heart, Powerful and Impactful messages, one play, one musical, at a time!  Keep doing what you are doing because… You are “The most beautiful thing in the world!!”   If you haven’t seen a Drayton show before, what are you waiting for?  You will have THE time of your life and will come back again and again. Guaranteed.

title: Fiddler On The Roof
content: Wonderful! We went to see Kinky Boots and it was amazing. The actors, music, production and theatre were all great. Highly recommend it!

title: Wonderful!
content: Great show. Wonderful voices and a storyline which is applicable today. Enjoyed by entire family including A 9 and 11 year Olds.

title: A fantastic show and the actors were superb even Santa Claus !!!
content: Because of timing and other commitments, 3 of us went to a Matinee not expecting the same experience as the glitz of an evening performance. We were very happily surprised and thrilled with the performance, the singing, the amazing dancing, and the props. We got teary-eyed in the same places, and were sad when the show was over.  Kudos to those actors who can give such performances time-after-time and whether for a matinee or not. It was special.It was extra nice to come out into the dark to see the Christmas decorating of the Gaslight District and to enjoy a wonderful dinner at the Foundry Tavern. With everything being so close together, it made for a very fun time for us and we'd do it again in a heartbeat.
